issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.summary: [C++] Error in./configure step for jemalloc when building on OSX 10.14.6

comments.body: Or {{export SDKROOT="$(xcrun --show-sdk-path)"}} will also fix this.

Yes. Confirming that the C++ build works with that SDKROOT export.

The two questions for me are: 1) was my environment broken in some weird way for the initial build to fail like this, and, if not 2) what's the best way to fix things so that they "just work"?

I confirmed that this fails for me out of the box on macOS, too

{code}
$ make jemalloc_ep
Scanning dependencies of target jemalloc_ep
[ 33%] Creating directories for 'jemalloc_ep'
[ 33%] Performing download step (download, verify and extract) for 'jemalloc_ep'
-- jemalloc_ep download command succeeded.  See also /Users/wesm/code/arrow/cpp/brew-build/jemalloc_ep-prefix/src/jemalloc_ep-stamp/jemalloc_ep-download-*.log
[ 66%] Performing patch step for 'jemalloc_ep'
[ 66%] No update step for 'jemalloc_ep'
[ 66%] Performing configure step for 'jemalloc_ep'
CMake Error at /Users/wesm/code/arrow/cpp/brew-build/jemalloc_ep-prefix/src/jemalloc_ep-stamp/jemalloc_ep-configure-DEBUG.cmake:49 (message):
  Command failed: 1

   './configure' 'AR=/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/ar' 'CC=/Applications/Xcode.app/Contents/Developer/Toolchains/XcodeDefault.xctoolchain/usr/bin/cc' '--prefix=/Users/wesm/code/arrow/cpp/brew-build/jemalloc_ep-prefix/src/jemalloc_ep/dist/' '--with-jemalloc-prefix=je_arrow_' '--with-private-namespace=je_arrow_private_' '--without-export' '--disable-cxx' '--disable-libdl' '--disable-initial-exec-tls'

  See also

    /Users/wesm/code/arrow/cpp/brew-build/jemalloc_ep-prefix/src/jemalloc_ep-stamp/jemalloc_ep-configure-*.log


make[3]: *** [jemalloc_ep-prefix/src/jemalloc_ep-stamp/jemalloc_ep-configure] Error 1
make[2]: *** [CMakeFiles/jemalloc_ep.dir/all] Error 2
make[1]: *** [CMakeFiles/jemalloc_ep.dir/rule] Error 2
make: *** [jemalloc_ep] Error 2
{code}

I think this is something we need to fix in the build system.
It might be that we fail to configure the build if SDKROOT is not set. I googled a bit about this and didn't find consistent advice other than using SDKROOT. It could be an issue with CMake itself

Hmm. At least for me, the Arrow C++ developer docs didn't mention that I needed / should set SDKROOT, so that's why it wasn't set.

I'm using CMake 3.15.4, if that helps.
I think this is a new issue with newer versions of Xcode, this was not required in the past as far as I know
I think it's possible to set SDKROOT dynamically when building jemalloc, I'll try to submit a patch
